ref: 1237 *āmagandha -- , āmagandhi -- , ˚in -- , ˚ika -- ʻ smelling like raw meat, smelling musty ʼ lex. [āmá -- , gandhá -- ]
Pa. āmagandha -- m. ʻ smell of rotting corpses, verminous odour ʼ;
K. āmun m. ʻ smell of burning or scorching cloth (e
sp. cotton) ʼ, āman f. ʻ malodorousness (e
sp. of food going bad) ʼ, āmanun ʻ to go bad (of food), to become malodorous ʼ.
